amendment.description: Amendment originally sought to require OPIC to settle claims within 90 days, allow a 60 day extension for receipt of supplemental information, and pay interest at the prime rate for each day after the specified time limit. \ As amended by the Menendez amendment (A008), the above was replaced with language that requires GAO to submit to Congress a report which reviews the claims activities of OPIC.
amendment.purpose: Amendment no. 10 printed in the Congressional Record to require OPIC to settle claims within 90 days, allow a 60 day extension for receipt of supplemental information, and pay interest at the prime rate for each day after the specified time limit.

action.text: Terry amendment (A007) modified by unanimous consent. The modification makes technical changes.
On agreeing to the Terry amendment (A007) as modified and amended Agreed to by voice vote.
